CatDescriptText: Harold Zimmerman, gear cutter, Millvale, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 17, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe that city patrolmen and firemen should be required to work more than 40 hours per week?" answer reads: "In emergencies, yes, but they should be paid the same as you and I are when we work overtime."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Harold Zimmerman wearing light colored shirt and belt with buckle monogrammed "H," standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
